title: After a year of world records, heatwaves and floods continue to rage across the planet
summary: All continents are experiencing or have recently experienced episodes of extreme heat, drought or torrential rain. These are direct effects of human-induced climate change, exacerbated by the El Niño phenomenon.

title: Macron accepts PM's resignation, government shifts to caretaker role
summary: President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday accepted the resignation of Prime Minister Gabriel Attal's government, which will now remain only in a caretaker capacity.

title: Paris airport staff call off pre-Olympics strike
summary: Unions had called for a stoppage on Wednesday to press for bigger Olympics bonuses and staff recruitment. They announced on Tuesday they had reached a deal on bonuses.

title: French Rugby scandal: 'There will be a before and after Mendoza,' promises Federation President
summary: Following the events in Argentina, where Melvyn Jaminet made racist remarks and Hugo Auradou and Oscar Jegou were charged with 'aggravated rape,' Florian Grill has announced that he intends to increase punishments in the event of misconduct.

title: Musk to move X and SpaceX headquarters from California to Texas over transgender law
summary: The multi-billionaire said Tuesday he plans on moving SpaceX from Hawthorne to Starbase while X will move to Austin from San Francisco. He called a new law signed Monday by California's Governor that bars school districts from requiring staff to notify parents of their child’s gender identification change the 'final straw.'

title: Watch: Kylian Mbappé presented to 80,000 Real Madrid fans
summary: Mbappé donned the white shirt and gave his first speech at the Santiago-Bernabéu stadium on July 16.

title: Musk and Thiel put their fortunes and networks to work for Trump and Vance
summary: The two Silicon Valley billionaires have launched a vast fundraising drive to finance the Republican candidate's campaign.

title: Six killed in rare Oman attack claimed by Islamic State group
summary: The jihadist group said three of its fighters were behind the shootings that targeted 'Shiites practicing their annual rituals' on the occasion of the holy mourning period of Ashura.

title: Trump assassination attempt: On social media, the shooter's elusive background fuels conspiracies
summary: The assassination attempt on the former US president, who is running for re-election, has triggered an avalanche of mostly wild speculation.

title: New Caledonia's economy collapses after two months of insurrection
summary: Already nearly bankrupt at the start of 2024, the New Caledonian government is facing massive unemployment caused by the destruction of businesses, shops and public infrastructure since the insurrection began on May 13.

title: What are the powers of a caretaker government in France?
summary: Prime Minister Gabriel Attal's government could remain in office for an indefinite period of time to handle day-to-day affairs, with restricted powers, until President Emmanuel Macron names a new prime minister.

title: US Senator Bob Menendez found guilty on all counts in corruption trial
summary: The 70-year-old politician was convicted on Tuesday of a number of corrupt acts including taking bribes including gold bars, a luxury car and cash and acting as a foreign agent for the Egyptian government.

title: Nepal, the world champion of political instability
summary: The small Himalayan republic has just appointed its 14th prime minister in 15 years, illustrating a culture of purely transactional public affairs as a growing number of unemployed young people leave the country.

title: Trump assassination attempt: Secret Service and local law enforcement trade blame
summary: The Secret Service believes that it was only responsible for the inner perimeter of the Republican rally on July 13 in Butler, Pennsylvania, and not for the outer area, where the shooter was positioned, which was entrusted to the local police.

title: Malta's Metsola re-elected as EU Parliament president
summary: Roberta Metsola has overwhelmingly won another two-and-a-half-year mandate after receiving 562 out of 699 MEP votes.

title: Rugby international Jaminet under investigation over racist remarks
summary: Prosecutors said they had opened an investigation after the player was filmed saying he wanted to attack Arabs.

title: Moroccan academia mobilizes against normalization with Israel
summary: More and more students and teachers are calling for a halt to the partnerships forged by part of the Moroccan academic world with Israeli universities.

title: J.D. Vance, Donald Trump's running mate: A student of Trumpism and potential heir
summary: The 39-year-old senator from Ohio was sworn in on Monday, the first day of the Republican convention in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. While he brings youth to the former president's ticket, he does not allow him to broaden his base.

title: Murder of a Kazakh opposition journalist in Kyiv strains relations between Ukraine and Kazakhstan
summary: Aidos Sadykov's murder was carried out by two Kazakh citizens, possibly linked to Kazakhstan's security services.

title: Rheinmetall becomes flagship of German rearmament at the risk of making enemies in Russia
summary: Germany's leading defense group secured a series of historic contracts and is working hard to transform the arms industry's public image which has long been seen as shameful in Germany. But according to CNN, the group's CEO was recently targeted by an assassination attempt.

title: Writer Corinne Maier: 'It's time for women to assert their right to selfishness'
summary: Women are still too often servants devoted to domestic life, laments Corinne Maier. In an interview with 'Le Monde,' the author urges them to 'break free from the social conditioning that prepares girls to devote themselves to others'

title: Tour de France:  Belgium's Philipsen wins day 16 spring stage
summary: Jasper Philipsen pushed through a tight pack to cross the line first in Nîmes on Tuesday but rival Biniam Girmay retains the green sprint points jersey, even though he fell in the final dash.

title: Alcohol, a major but underestimated cause of everyday violence
summary: The consumption of alcohol, and sometimes drugs, plays a central role in violence committed in France, particularly within the family circle. Across the country, judges, police officers and addiction specialists are observing the extent of this phenomenon.

title: What economists say about the French left's policies
summary: Le Monde asked a panel of experts about the three main measures proposed by the Nouveau Front Populaire left-wing coalition: lowering the retirement age, raising the minimum wage and taxing the richest. They were divided.

title: Trump feted by former rivals in show of Republican unity after assassination attempt
summary: Several failed primary challengers took the stage at the Republican Convention on Tuesday, to publicly throw their support behind the former president, including onetime UN ambassador Nikki Haley. The displays of unity stood in stark contrast to the dynamic facing Democrats.

title: Paris Mayor Hidalgo dives into the Seine and the Olympic deep end
summary: With less than two years to go before the municipal elections, the mayor of Paris will benefit from the spotlight of the Olympic Games organized in the city, to which she made a major contribution. In her usual way.

title: War in Ukraine: Zelensky wants Russia to take part in a new peace summit
summary: The Ukrainian president's invitation to 'Russian representatives' to attend a peace conference in November suggests a softening of Kyiv's diplomatic stance, against a backdrop of military difficulties.

title: Human Rights Watch report debunks Hamas denials of October 7 attack
summary: The investigators believe that Hamas militants are guilty of war crimes and crimes against humanity − refuting the Islamist movement's claims that any atrocities carried out were because of the 'chaos' of the situation.

title: Pogacar's impossibly fast climb to the Plateau de Beille, the 2024 Tour de France's tipping point
summary: For some years now, each edition of the Tour has had a 'tipping point' when the festive atmosphere at the start gives way to doubts and endless unanswered questions.

title: FIFA to open probe into Argentina players' racist chants
summary: A video caught Argentina players in a bus singing racist chants directed at French player Kylian Mbappé, leading the French Football Federation to complain.

title: US presidential election: Haley and DeSantis pledge allegiance to Trump at Republican convention
summary: On the second day of the convention, the governor of Florida and the former UN ambassador, both defeated and battered during the primaries, praised the Republican candidate.

title: The left's procrastination on picking a prime minister threatens its new-found unity
summary: Ten days of fruitless discussions between the leaders of the parties of the Nouveau Front Populaire have led to only one obvious conclusion: United and effective in the fight against the far right, the left loses all cohesion when it's on the doorstep of power.

title: The Fondation Maeght gets a modern makeover
summary: To mark its 60th anniversary, the temple of avant-garde creation from the 1960s is inaugurating an extension to showcase its permanent collection. Choreographers, fashion designers, DJs and rock and pop stars are also taking part in the revival of this legendary venue in Saint-Paul-de-Vence.

title: UNRWA headquarters in Gaza City in ruins following recent Israeli air raid
summary: The Israeli army claims to have fought against Hamas and Islamic Jihad fighters ambushed in the UN compound. The agency in charge of Palestinian refugees has called for an investigation.

title: UK Labour government policy laid out in king's address
summary: Labour's first plan for government in 15 years includes promises of economic stability, tougher action on irregular immigration and improving relations with Europe soured by Brexit.

title: Jacques Boudet, actor in many of Robert Guédiguian's films, has died
summary: The actor used his great height and big voice in a number of supporting film roles, playing patriarchs, tradesmen and dignitaries. He died at his home in Hérault on July 15, aged 89.

title: Jean-Claude Lenoir, leading figure in helping migrants in Calais, has died
summary: The retired teacher, a tireless campaigner for the rights of asylum seekers, was a prominent figure in the Calais charity community. He died on July 11, aged 72.

title: Abbé Pierre, French priest known for charity work, accused of sexual assaults
summary: In a report by two charities he founded, seven women accused Abbé Pierre, who died in 2007, of sexual assaults between 1970 and 2005.

title: Watch: Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo swims in the Seine
summary: The mayor of the French capital brought attention to Seine's expensive clean-up job ahead of the Paris 2024 Olympics. Three swimming events will take place in the river during the competition.

title: Sodexo's discreet operations in Russia
summary: The French catering and facilities company tried to keep its work on the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline site invisible, until its withdrawal from the country in 2022. Now an official partner of the Paris Olympic Games, it says that it hasn't violated any sanctions.

summary: Since the dissolution of the Assemblée and the election of new ministers, the French political situation has raised a number of questions, to which Le Monde attempts to provide some answers.

summary: Relive the highlights of the tenth week of the torch's journey, which reached Paris for two days of celebrations.

summary: The former winner of the road race in the Tokyo Olympics, the Ecuadorian rider won stage 17. While Tadej Pogacar, Jonas Vinegaard and Remco Evenepoel engaged in a late scrap of attacks and counter-attacks.

title: 'The Bear' season 3 can't escape its growing pains
summary: Christopher Storer's series goes through a pause of introspection and uncertainty, illuminated by the creator's writing and the work of the actors.
